fields.customfield_10060:
​# Default checklist
​--- Definition of Ready
​* [open] The story has a single concern
​* [open] The story has clear acceptance criteria
​* [open] The story includes an overview of involved services, resources and teams
​* [open] The story has no conflicting issue or blocking tickets
​* [open] The story is clear to every developer
​* [open] The story should define which tests should be run (and passed)
​--- Definition of Done
​* [open] The story includes a comment, stating which tests have been added (referring the tests defined in the DoR)
​* [open] The story includes a comment stating the result of the review
​* [open] Code is matching the coding guidelines
​* [open] All discussions in merge-request are closed
​* [open] Gitlab-CI pipeline is green
​* [open] Merge-request is merged successfully
​* [open] Code has been deployed on the test/staging system
​* [open] Implementation, Data and Code changes have been reviewed
​* [open] Tests have been reviewed, to ensure they test the right thing
​* [open] Documentation (Code / Functionality / Architecture) has been added, preferably including examples
fields.customfield_10052:
*Description:*
_A brief summary of what this is about on the funcional level._
_(The Devs will decide themselves HOW it will get implemented in the Action Points so please use simple, understandable language to describe the required function in a way that anyone can understand.)_
_Please apply the User Story format: 
"As a [ROLE / TYPE OF USER], I would like [FUNCTION / ACTION] so that [VALUE / BENEFIT]."_ 


*Affected Systems & Teams:*
_Involved services and resources._
_Involved teams and what needs to be coordinated._


*Acceptance Criteria*
_achievable and verifiable criteria that the solution must meet in order to be considered completed._


*Action Points (usually written by the Devs):*
_The points that must be addressed to implement the issue, from the technical perspective._

*Testing (usually written by the Devs):*
_What needs to be tested?_
_How should it get tested?_
_What corner cases have to be included?_
_Do we have everything that's necessary for these tests?_
fields.customfield_10053:
*Description:*
_COMPLAINT_: The report for an ongoing attack (not ended) could be clicked on but resulted in a 500 error. Requested it be reported/treated as a Bug. When it became available it contained data which made little sense in their opinion.

_EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR_: not clickable, or “not available” instead of 500 error message.

# Report stated 1.1.1970 for end state, we all know this date 0. “Ongoing”, “in Process”, “not ended” would have been correct.
# Same for duration, it states 0 instead of “x minutes (so far)”.  

_SOLUTION:_ Adjust Attack Reports to reflect the clients' expectations as stated above. 

*See attached Screenshots.*

*Steps to reproduce:*
_Was unable to reproduce the 500 error the client received (likely was due to a communication issue at the time?)_

*Affected Systems:*
_WebDDoS Attack Reporting_

*Checklist:*
_If there is a particular customer behind this issue, fill in the fields Affected Customer_
_If there is a support ticket behind this, please set this field with the OTRS Link. This is important as we use this to filter for customer-related tickets._
_Set the Due Date in case we promise a certain date to the customer._
_Does this issue describe only one concern? Otherwise create separate tickets_
_Is the priority set correctly?_

*Action Points (usually written by Devs):*
_what needs to be done to address this issue?_
_hints to which places in the code might be relevant?_
fields.customfield_10058:
*What are the questions that should be answered with the new documentation?*
_Put a brief summary of what this is about. Please be precise with your statements._

*Is this doable in 4 hours?*
_if not, please split this ticket up._


*Is there already any documentation relevant to this topic?*
_If this is the case, put the link here._ 

*Which department is responsible for creating the documentation:*
_Choose wisely:_
_CSM_
_DEV_
_OPS_

fields.customfield_10046:
# Default checklist
--- Definition of Ready
* [open] The story has a single concern
* [open] The story has clear acceptance criteria
* [open] The story includes an overview of involved services, resources and teams
* [open] The story has no conflicting issue or blocking tickets
* [open] The story is clear to every developer
* [open] The story should define which tests should be run (and passed)
--- Definition of Done
* [open] The story includes a comment, stating which tests have been added (referring the tests defined in the DoR)
* [open] The story includes a comment stating the result of the review
* [open] Code is matching the coding guidelines
* [open] All discussions in merge-request are closed
* [open] Gitlab-CI pipeline is green
* [open] Merge-request is merged successfully
* [open] Code has been deployed on the test/staging system
* [open] Implementation, Data and Code changes have been reviewed
* [open] Tests have been reviewed, to ensure they test the right thing
* [open] Documentation (Code / Functionality / Architecture) has been added, preferably including examples

fields.customfield_10098:
*Description:*
_Describe what the feature does and why it is valuable to the user. Be as specific as possible._

*Affected Systems & Teams:*
_Involved services and resources._
_Involved teams and what needs to be coordinated._


*Acceptance Criteria*
_achievable and verifiable criteria that the feature must meet in order to be completed and ready for release. This should include both functional and non-functional requirements._


*Design Requirements:*
_Does the feature require any new designs/wireframes or changes to the existing user interface? If so, please outline the according requirements here._

*Success Metrics:*
_Outline the key performance indicators (KPIs) that will be used to measure the success of this feature. This could include user engagement, adoption rates, or other relevant metrics._
fields.summary: Encountered a 500 Error when opening Attack Report #104823
